list.name: Changes
list.comment: Added detailed end-of-match statistics for both player and AI - Introduced `GameStatistics` class to accumulate match data across rounds with `updateRoundStatistics()` method and shows them with `showFinalStatistics()` method - Created `PointType` and `EarnedBy` enums to track point origins and owners - Final match summary includes: • Total rounds played • Final score with detailed breakdown (cards, coins, settebello, prime) • Number of scopas • Total cards and coins captured • Capture percentage - Updated `GameController` and `GameState` accordingly to manage the `EnumMap<PointType, EarnedBy> pointWinners` and save point owners - Improved formatting and structure of end-game output in `GameLogger` for better clarity

task.summary: Default task
First commit
Translated in english other terms and names remained in italian; in GameState added missing methods/getter/setter necessary for the operation of GameController

Removed JFrame and Listener libraries/dependencies; Added constructor and private methods for: 1. Starting the game (startGame), 2. Distribution cards (dealCards...), 3. Round and turn management between player and computer (playRound/playerMove/aiMove), 4. Basic logic of possible catches (findPossibleCaptures), 5. Round end (checkRoundEnd/endRound), 6. Log, print and main test methods for debugging.
P.S. Currently no point calculation, no player choice and no AI logic implemented
Update of build/gradle file
Added a generic method for the player and AI move and removed the duplication; optimized print and log messages to reduce repetitions
Added method that implements a more intelligent AI decision logic based on some priorities in the choice of card to play

Added rule for which the last take does not count as an additional point (scopa); Added rule for the distribution at the end of the round of the last table cards to the last one that have a capture Small corrections to log messages and prints and comments
Optimized Scanner usage and closing to improve memory management and prevents potential resource leaks
Optimized getBestCaptureForCard() by replacing the unnecessary new ArrayList instance with the clear method on the same list
Update of build/gradle file
Updated logs to display the chosen name instead of a generic "PLAYER"

Add "quit to menu" feature and input handling improvements
- Introduced "quit" command to allow players to leave the game and return to the main menu during input phases. - Added `quitToMenu` flag and `setQuitToMenu()` method in GameController - Refactored `selectPlayerCard()` and `determineDealer()` to support quit command, updated `playerMove()` - Adjusted Main.java to restart or terminate the game properly based on quit detection
- Created new `InputManager` class to centralize input logic - Provides method `readLineWithQuit()` that safely handles input with escape option
- Improved `determineDealer()` logic: - Fixed index bug (using input value as index in player's choice) - Added randomized draw selection for AI instead of always selecting the first card

Refactor Game Flow & Introduce Endgame Menu - Introduced end-of-game menu in `GameController.java` with options: • Replay a new match (or not) • Return to main menu • View match statistics (placeholder for now) - Moved final match options into `showEndGameMenu()` for better separation of concerns - Added `playAgainVariable` boolean flag to manage loop control in `startGame()` instead of returning from within the option method - Handled match ties by increasing `winningScore` dynamically if both players reach the same final score (I thought it was already done right) - Refactored input reading in confirmation rematch prompts using `nextLine()` instead of `next()` to avoid newline consumption issues - Minor aesthetic improvements across `GameLogger.java`, `Main.java`, `InputManager.java`, and `GameState.java` to enhance terminal UI consistency - Removed final modifier from `winningScore` to allow dynamic updates in special tie cases (don't know if it's correct to) - Introduced scaffolding for match statistics section, to be completed in future updates - Ensured clean round reset and loop continuity

Added detailed end-of-match statistics for both player and AI - Introduced `GameStatistics` class to accumulate match data across rounds with `updateRoundStatistics()` method and shows them with `showFinalStatistics()` method - Created `PointType` and `EarnedBy` enums to track point origins and owners - Final match summary includes: • Total rounds played • Final score with detailed breakdown (cards, coins, settebello, prime) • Number of scopas • Total cards and coins captured • Capture percentage - Updated `GameController` and `GameState` accordingly to manage the `EnumMap<PointType, EarnedBy> pointWinners` and save point owners - Improved formatting and structure of end-game output in `GameLogger` for better clarity
